author: A_Brickset_user
title: A real classic
review: This steam locomotive is a real classic with its red undercarriage and black body. The tender containing the red engine makes it complete. I particularly like the black hoses, the big red wheels and the tender. Most of the other steam locomitives (7727 or 7730) don't have a tender. It's a must-have for every 12V train fan.

author: Lego7755Fan2
title: The First Large Steam Engine
review:
The First steam engine with large wheels. 30 Years before BBB wheels, LEGO made large Drivers. It has a tender too. The Engine is a Work of art. It is the Emrald night 31 years ago! Worth buying if you have the Cash! They cost about $550 on Bricklink

Pros

  • Large Drivers
  • Tender
  • Both rare black Windows
  • Red Motor

 

  • Great engine with Rare parts and good colors. Perfect for any layout.

author: Crazy_Chris
title: King of the steam engines
review:
Overview
Year of release: 1980
Last year in catalog: 1982
Set type: single locomotive (advanced level / 12v operated)
Generation (within grey era): 1.0
Predecessor (within grey era): none
Successor (within grey era): 7755

Description
A big steam engine with lights, this is the second out of three sets that came with a red 12v motor. As everyone knows, it is the only set that uses the big red train wheels (except some service packs, which I don't consider being a real set). Therefore, the motor is hidden under the tender - what a smart idea. Moreover, the model is equipped with lights, both at the front of the engine and at the end of the tender. The black 2x1 "cable" bricks are also unique to this set.

Variants and alternate parts
It is unclear if this set is affected by the three different versions of the red 12v motor. Most likely, this set was released with at least two different versions of it.

Personal opinion
The grey era offers lots of different steam engines: 3x push-a-long, 1x battery operated, and 3x 12v operated. This one is the biggest and greatest of them. And the most expensive, especially if you need a complete box in good condition.
